article_body.content: Foong Swee Fong argues that Bilahari’s piece on ST Forum shows Singapore’s lack of true sovereignty. While aligning with the U.S. ensures security and prosperity, it also risks hypocrisy, weakens independence, and strains ASEAN relations. After 60 years, true independence is needed.
Bilahari Kausikan’s opinion piece, 'Facing up to the realities of Trump 2.0,' admits that Singapore lacks full sovereignty.
He states that 'self-interest is the core organizing concept of international relations,' implying Singapore is similar to Donald Trump’s America.
Singapore supported the 2003 Iraq invasion and took a strong stance against Russia’s invasion of Ukraine in 2022, both in its own interest.
Bilahari argues that Europe can't deter Russia without US support, and Asian allies cannot balance China alone. Despite grumbling, there is no alternative to the US.
He suggests that Singapore's interests require it to 'accommodate America’s demands,' as seen in the recent crackdown on smuggling Nvidia chips to China.
Depending on a powerful friend for survival is risky. As Henry Kissinger said, 'To be an enemy of the US is dangerous, but to be a friend is fatal.'
Saddam Hussein was once America’s ally in the 1980s but was later overthrown. This highlights the unpredictability of great-power relationships.
Singapore buys the latest US fighter jets with taxpayer money, while neighboring countries use much older models.
Singapore’s FTA with the US enforces strict intellectual property rights, raising prices of medicine, software, and other products.
The FTA allows unlimited American professionals to work in Singapore, while Singaporeans face work quotas in the US.
Americans are exempt from Additional Buyer’s Stamp Duty (ABSD) when buying property in Singapore. During Covid, American vaccines were prioritized over Chinese ones.
Singapore sanctioned Russia for violating international law but did not impose sanctions on Israel despite accusations of genocide in Palestine.
Bilahari suggests Singapore accommodates America’s demands selectively—sanctioning Russia but not Israel—because of US strategic interests.
Accommodating US demands may force the government to make decisions that do not align with the people's will, eroding sovereignty.
After 60 years of independence, it's time for Singapore to become truly independent.
